subject: Business
title: Freemium Pricing Psychology
description: A 60-second lesson on Freemium Pricing Psychology.

hook.text: Zero is not just a low price. It's a completely different category in the brain. Free triggers irrational excitement.

buildup.text: Dan Ariely showed that a free chocolate was chosen 2x more than a 1-cent chocolate.

discovery.text: Free eliminates the fear of loss. There's no risk in taking something free, so decision friction vanishes.

twist.text: But free users are hard to convert. They anchor at zero, and any price above that feels like a loss.

climax.text: The trick: make free genuinely valuable but incomplete. The upgrade must solve a pain free users already feel.

punchline.text: Free gets them in. Value keeps them. Pain converts them.

quiz.question: Why is 'free' psychologically different from 'very cheap'?
options: Free eliminates the fear of loss entirely
Free products are always better quality
People can't do math with small numbers
